description: The village where the former slave girl Koala was returned by Fisher Tiger and the Sun Pirates. After Tiger's death, Arlong attempted to attack this village but was stopped by Vice-Admiral Borsalino.

keyEvents.title: Arlong Attempts Revenge
keyEvents.description: Arlong attempts to massacre the villagers, believing they betrayed Fisher Tiger to the Marines.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Arlong's hatred leads him to violence, only to be stopped by Borsalino.

keyEvents.title: Borsalino Defeats Arlong
keyEvents.description: Vice-Admiral Borsalino easily defeats Arlong at this village, preventing a massacre.
keyEvents.significance: Prevents tragedy and leads to Arlong's capture.

statusHistory.reason: Village remains safe after Borsalino's intervention

description: A Marine base where Arlong was interrogated after his capture by Vice-Admiral Borsalino. This is where Arlong lied about Fisher Tiger's death to the Marines.

keyEvents.title: Arlong's Interrogation
keyEvents.description: Arlong is interrogated at the G-2 Base and lies about Fisher Tiger's death, claiming humans refused him a blood transfusion.
keyEvents.significance: The lie spreads anti-human propaganda while protecting Tiger's honor.

description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level, home to fish-men and merfolk. This episode shows the impact of Fisher Tiger's death on the island's population and Otohime's peace efforts.

keyEvents.title: Petition Signatures Withdrawn
keyEvents.description: Citizens of Fish-Man Island withdraw their signatures from Otohime's petition following news of Fisher Tiger's death.
keyEvents.significance: Shows how tragedy can reverse years of progress toward peace.

keyEvents.title: Otohime's Broadcast
keyEvents.description: Otohime's drunken, passionate rant is broadcast across the entire island.
keyEvents.significance: Despite despair, her raw emotion begins reaching some hearts.

description: The royal palace of Fish-Man Island, home to the Neptune royal family. Queen Otohime receives news of Fisher Tiger's death here and later broadcasts her passionate speech from the palace.

keyEvents.title: News of Tiger's Death Arrives
keyEvents.description: Jinbe's letter about Fisher Tiger's death reaches Neptune and Otohime at the palace.
keyEvents.significance: The news triggers major political and social consequences on Fish-Man Island.

statusHistory.reason: Palace remains as the royal residence

description: The world's greatest prison where Arlong was held after his capture by Borsalino. He was released when Jinbe became a Shichibukai and secured pardons for all Sun Pirates members.

keyEvents.title: Arlong Released
keyEvents.description: Arlong is released from Impel Down thanks to Jinbe's Shichibukai pardon.
keyEvents.significance: Arlong's release leads directly to the Sun Pirates split and eventually his reign of terror in the East Blue.
